It can be stretched or torn during various activities, including sexual intercourse, physical activities, medical examinations, or even through regular daily activities. Contrary to common misconceptions, the presence, absence, or condition of the hymen does not determine a person's virginity or sexual history. An imperforate hymen is a condition in which the hymen completely covers the opening of the vagina, leaving no opening for menstrual blood to pass through.
